`epipredict` supports visualizations features. However, it is not intended for
those who use third-party data visualization software such as Power BI and
Tableau.

```{r}
library(covidcast)
library(dplyr)
x <- case_death_rate_subset %>%
  filter(!(geo_value %in% c("as","cm","gu","mp","vi")),
         time_value >= "2021-06-24", time_value <= "2021-06-30")

cc <- x %>%
  select(-death_rate, value = case_rate) %>%
  as.covidcast_signal(geo_type = "state",
                      data_source = "covid-tracking",
                      signal = "case_rate")

plot(cc)
```

```{r}
x_total <- case_death_rate_subset %>%
  filter(!(geo_value %in% c("as","cm","gu","mp","vi"))) %>%
  group_by(geo_value) %>%
  summarize(total_case_rate = sum(case_rate))
arrange(x_total,desc(total_case_rate))
```
